line.text: Being your slave what should I do but tend
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Upon the hours and times of your desire
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: I have no precious time at all to spend
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Nor services to do till you require
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Nor dare I chide the world-without-end hour
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Whilst I (my sovereign) watch the clock for you
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Nor think the bitterness of absence sour
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: When you have bid your servant once adieu
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Nor dare I question with my jealous thought
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Where you may be or your affairs suppose
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: But like a sad slave stay and think of nought
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Save where you are how happy you make those
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: So true a fool is love that in your will
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: (Though you do any thing) he thinks no ill
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
